Title: Recommended update for sles12sp3-docker-image, sles12sp4-image, system-user-root

Notes.Text: Recommended update for sles12sp3-docker-image, sles12sp4-image, system-user-root
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for sles12sp3-docker-image, sles12sp4-image, system-user-root fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2019-5021: Include an invalidated root password by default, not an empty one (bsc#1134524)
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Containers 12

Vulnerabilities.Description: Versions of the Official Alpine Linux Docker images (since v3.3) contain a NULL password for the `root` user. This vulnerability appears to be the result of a regression introduced in December of 2015. Due to the nature of this issue, systems deployed using affected versions of the Alpine Linux container which utilize Linux PAM, or some other mechanism which uses the system shadow file as an authentication database, may accept a NULL password for the `root` user.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15:system-user-root-20190513-3.3.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Containers 12:suse-sles12sp3-image-2.0.2-22.1
